results.title: Footprints on the Mountains
results.creator_credit: Denise Mack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: At age 11 Denise Mack is told secretly by her mother that her heritage isn’t Irish, that her grandfather was Lebanese and her grandmother, Chinese. Through this story, Denise journeys along the path of her ancestry to bring her closer to herself.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denise Mack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Lockington Film Premiere: ACMI in the Regions
results.brief_description: In July 2008, the ACMI Content Development crew spent four days in Lockington and produced five short documentary films. The premier screening of these short films took place on the 15th of January 2009, on a hot and humid Thursday evening in the Lockington & District Community Centre. Over 200 locals joined Tony Sweeney and Kim Montgomery, from ACMI, and Louise Ross, a local and chief community organiser, to showcase the films and celebrate the stories that make Lockington a thriving and unique regional town. This film of the premiere screenings captures the excitement of the locals with a red carpet arrival for all the guests, the handing out of DVDs to all individuals that were involved in the project and finally vox pops from the audience members as they share with us their appreciation and pride for the films.

results.title: Tripoli Melbourne & Me!
results.creator_credit: Dania Dabliz, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dania Dabliz’s life in Tripoli was full of fun, friends and parties. When she migrated to Melbourne she wondered if she would find the same things again?

results.title: Lockington Living Heritage Complex
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Celebrating and preserving the rich history of Lockington and its surrounding district, the dedicated and hard working volunteers of the Lockington Living Heritage Complex take us on a tour of the complex with the highlight being ‘The Big Shed’ which at 106 metres houses a restored Melbourne tram and the first ever pop top caravan, hand built in Lockington.

results.title: Living in Locky: The Youth Perspective
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: 17 year old Locky local, Emma McInnes interviews a cross section of young people to find out what life in a rural town is really like. What is there to do? What the future holds and the all important question, are there many lookers in Locky?

results.title: Ladies of Lockington
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the ladies who are at the heart of Lockington. These passionate and committed women get things done. They network, coordinate, manage and harness the talent that is available to them to improve and enhance the quality of life for all the families of Lockington and surrounding districts.

results.title: Loch Ladies
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film showcases the many women who drive business in the small Loch Village. The four women featured are representative of the many others who are involved in running businesses in the main street of Loch. These women are smart, funny, hard working and driven individuals who have turned their passion into profit.

results.title: Life is What You Make It
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Bob Bloch and Frank Arndt are both war veterans with very different stories but these men have the same vibrant enthusiasm for life. Bob Bloch ran the Meeniyan Pharmacy for over fifty years while living out his boyhood dream of becoming a pilot and restoring vintage cars. Frank Arndt, while a newcomer to the town, feels he has finally found his rightful place in Meeniyan and is heavily involved in community activities such as contract bridge and table tennis.
results.description: Bob Bloch and Frank Arndt are both war veterans with very different stories but these men have the same vibrant enthusiasm for life. Bob Bloch ran the Meeniyan Pharmacy for over fifty years while living out his boyhood dream of becoming a pilot and restoring vintage cars.
